p: Caliciviruses are single-stranded RNA viruses of positive polarity. They have an icosahedral capsid of approximately 30Â nm in diameter. These viruses are found in a large number of hosts, such as humans, primates, cats, pork, and chicken. The Caliciviridae family includes two kinds that can infect humans: NoV and SAV ( Adler and Zickl, 1969).
